business.headline: 'We wouldn't do that': ITC chief Sanjiv Puri shares view on 90-hour workweekThe 90-hour workweek debate, triggered by L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan's comments, has faced criticism from industry leaders and celebrities.

Credit score check: Why and how often should you review it?A credit score is a numerical measure of your creditworthiness, based on payment history, debt, and credit history length.

Budget 2025: How government can prioritise job creation and skill development The upcoming Budget 2025 is expected to focus on economic growth while addressing key challenges and leveraging opportunities.
Explained: Why Biocon shares surged 7% today Biocon share price: The stock has gained 9.66% in the last month, 7.99% over the past six months, and an impressive 37.98% in the last year.
Budget 2025: What NRIs are expecting from Nirmala SitharamanAll eyes are on the Union Budget 2025, set to be announced in February, for key reform announcements.

HCLTech shares tumble nearly 10% after Q3 results. What should investors do?Several brokerages have shared their views on the IT giant's Q3 results. Brokerage firm Morgan Stanley maintained an 'Equal-Weight' rating with a target price of Rs 1,970.
Truly disheartening: L&T HR head defends chairman amid 90-hour workweek rowL&T Chairman S N Subrahmanyan's 90-hour workweek remark has triggered debate on work-life balance.

Adani Power, Adani Green: Why Adani Group shares jumped up to 18% todayAdani Group shares: At 12:05 pm, Adani Power soared 18.05% to Rs 531.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), while Adani Green Energy climbed 14.15% to Rs 1,015.80. Adani Enterprises, the group's flagship company, was trading 8% higher at Rs 2,401.75.

JSW Energy shares price rises 6% today. Here's why JSW Energy share price: The stock has lost 20.14% in the last month and 23.69% over the past six months. Despite the recent decline, JSW Energy has gained 16.15% over the past year.

JSW Energy share price jumps nearly 7%. Why is it gaining today?JSW energy share price: The stock opened at Rs 528.15, and climbed to an intraday high of Rs 552.50 at around 11:07 am, marking a jump of 6.59% jump.

Explained: Why HCLTech share price fell nearly 10% despite positive Q3 resultsHCLTech share price: At 10:46 am, HCLTech's shares were trading 9.02% lower at Rs 1,806.20 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, its shares hit an intraday low of Rs 1,798.40.

Sensex, Nifty rebound: What's driving today's gains, and will the recovery last?Despite today's rally, the stock market remains under pressure due to several factors, especially the impact of Q3 earnings and sustained selling by foreign institutional investors.

Quadrant Future Tek listing: Shares make strong D-Street debut at 27% premium Quadrant Future Tek stock: The stock opened at Rs 370 on the NSE, reflecting a 27.5% premium over its IPO price of Rs 290.
Stock market rebound: Sensex, Nifty gain in early trade; HCLTech down 9% The S&P BSE Sensex gained 408.52 points to 76,738.53, while the NSE Nifty50 110.05 points to 23,196.00 as of 9:30 AM.

TikTok US may go to Elon Musk as China explores potential sale: ReportChinese authorities want to keep TikTok under the control of its parent company, ByteDance. One potential scenario involves Elon Musk's social media platform, X, acquiring TikTok US and running it jointly with ByteDance.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: India 'strongly' seeks return of nationals after Kerala man dies in Russia warKerala electrician Binil TB, recruited into Russia's Military Support Service, recently died in Ukraine's war zone. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has 'strongly' demanded early repatriation of remaining Indians deputed at the front line.

Sheikh Hasina's niece resigns as UK's anti-corruption minister after graft claimsTulip Siddiq, ousted Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's niece, resigned as the UK's anti-corruption minister after facing allegations over whether her family were involved in siphoning off funds from Bangladeshi infrastructure projects.

Kangana Ranaut's Emergency banned in Bangladesh amid strained ties: SourcesKangana Ranaut's film, Emergency, set to release in India on January 17, has been banned in Bangladesh. The ban is linked to the ongoing political tensions between both countries rather than the film's content.

South Korea investigators attempt to arrest President Yoon for second timeInvestigators gathered outside impeached President Yoon's residence on Wednesday in an attempt to arrest him over insurrection accusations related to his December 3 martial law declaration.

Who are the Naga Sadhus? Highlight of the Maha KumbhThe Naga Sadhus are India's mysterious warrior-ascetics, central to the Maha Kumbh Mela. Who are they, where do they come from, and where do they go after the festival?

Case against Haryana BJP chief, singer Rocky Mittal for alleged gang-rapeThe woman alleged that she was forced to consume alcohol and subsequently gang-raped by Haryana BJP chief Mohan Lal Badoli and singer Rocky Mittal at a hotel in Himachal Pradesh's Kasauli in 2023.

SpaceX launches Firefly satellites developed by India's PixxelThe launch took place from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California. The Falcon 9 rocket deployed Pixxel's Firefly constellation, comprising three advanced high-resolution commercial hyperspectral satellites.

Kate Middleton says she's relieved to be in remission after cancer treatmentKate Middleton, the Princess of Wales, said she was in remission from cancer and stressed she was "relieved" after she was diagnosed with the disease a year ago.

Black Warrant and the Ranga-Billa case: What really happened in and out of jailBlack Warrant, a prison drama, is currently streaming on Netflix. The show is based on a book of the same title and one of its episodes narrates the story of the infamous Ranga-Billa case.

Work longer or smarter? India debates L&T chief's '90-hour' work-week L&T chairman S.N. Subrahmanyan isn't the only corporate leader to have advocated longer work hours despite the proven detrimental impact on employee wellbeing and productivity

Biden rates lower than Trump, Obama, and Bush on key policies: Gallup pollUS President Joe Biden has received low ratings on key policy issues, including national defence, immigration, and federal debt, according to a recent Gallup poll. Biden's ratings are lower than his predecessors Donald Trump, Barack Obama, and George W. Bush. Biden is seen as a 'poor' and 'below average' President by many, according to the poll.

Rahul Gandhi's 'Paris wali Dilli' dig at Arvind Kejriwal as INDIA rift widensEscalating his attack on Arvind Kejriwal, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi visited a stream strewn with garbage in Delhi and took a jibe at the AAP chief's promise of making the national capital clean like Paris.

French woman loses Rs 7 crore after dating scammer pretending to be Brad PittThe ordeal began in February 2023 when Anne, an interior designer, received a message on social media from someone claiming to be Brad Pitt's mother.

Rift in Team India? BCCI to evaluate Gambhir's future post Champions TrophyGautam Gambhir's role as head coach is under scrutiny as India's Champions Trophy performance could determine his future, amid tensions over his efforts to dismantle the 'superstar culture' within the team. Concerns have arisen due to India's recent poor results and speculated rifts with key players, leading to a review by the BCCI.

Indians advance in green card queue, reveals US Visa BulletinThe prospects of Indian applicants for green cards in the US improved with advancements in employment-based categories, reveals the February 2025 Visa Bulletin. However, there has been no progress in the dates for the family-sponsored green card category.

Psychologist raped 50 girls over 15 years under guise of counselling, arrestedThe psychologist, identified as Rajesh Dhoke, a father of two, lured young girls under the guise of providing counselling at residential camps.

Navya Nanda shares solo Rann of Kutch pics, Shweta Bachchan asks if she went aloneNavya Naveli Nanda shares breathtaking photos from her visit to the Rann of Kutch, however, it was her mother, Shweta Bachchan's witty comment that gave a hilarious touch to Navya's post.

Vivian Dsena, Karan Veer Mehra, Rajat Dalal, Avinash Mishra, Eisha Singh, Shilpa Shirodkar, and Chum Darang are competing for the coveted trophy.

Ex-Union Minister, councillor Ariba Khan in Congress's 3rd list for Delhi pollsFormer Union Minister and veteran Congress leader Krishna Tirath has been fielded from Patel Nagar while Ariba Khan will face incumbent AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan in Okhla in February 5 Delhi Assembly polls.

Hamas's nod to draft deal for Gaza ceasefire and release of hostages: ReportThe US, Egypt and Qatar have spent the past year trying to mediate an end to the 15-month war and secure the release of dozens of hostages captured in Hamas's October 7, 2023, attack that triggered it.

Fans call Ranbir 'one of the best fathers' as he enjoys playtime with daughter RahaRanbir Kapoor was recently captured in a delightful video playing with his daughter, Raha. The video quickly went viral as it showcased Ranbir being a doting father.

sports.headline: Donyell Malen joins Aston Villa on permanent deal from Borussia DortmundAston Villa bolstered their attacking options by signing Dutch forward Donyell Malen from Borussia Dortmund for 23 million euros, with add-ons. Malen's experience and versatility are expected to strengthen Villa's push for European qualification and domestic success.

Steve Smith on being stuck at 9999 runs: Was thinking about Hazlewood's shirt noStar Australia batter Steve Smith opened up getting stuck at 9999 runs in Test cricket and revealed how he just kept thinking about Josh Hazlewood's jersey number ahead of the game.

Rishabh Pant set to play Ranji Trophy for Delhi, no confirmation over Virat KohliStar India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is all set to play for Delhi in their upcoming Ranji Trophy fixture against Saurashtra. However, there's no confirmation on Virat Kohli yet.

India edge closer to Kho Kho World Cup knockouts after outclassing BrazilTeam India triumphed over Brazil 64-34 at the Kho Kho World Cup 2025, while the Indian women's team secured a historic 175-18 victory over South Korea, setting the stage for a dominant display on Day 2.

Fonseca's reveals Roger Federer-inspired mantra behind Rublev stunnerJoao Fonseca, an 18-year-old tennis sensation from Brazil, stunned world No. 9 Andrey Rublev at the Australian Open and credited Roger Federer's advice for shaping his grounded approach amid rising fame.

Virat Kohli's time has gone: Former England cricketer on India star's futureFormer England cricketer David Lloyd has made a big statement on the future of the star India batter Virat Kohli saying that his time is over in Test cricket.

Shubman Gill to join Punjab Ranji Trophy side for Karnataka clash: ReportsShubman Gill is reportedly set to join the Punjab Ranji Trophy side for their upcoming crucial clash against Karnataka, marking his return to domestic cricket as he looks to regain form following recent challenges on the international stage.

Watch: Wasim Akram unveils the iconic white jacket for Champions Trophy 2025Legendary Pakistan fast bowler Wasim Akram unveiled the iconic white jacket for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 set to begin from February 19.

Jemimah Rodrigues rises to top-20 in ICC rankings after maiden century vs IrelandJemimah Rodrigues' maiden ODI century propelled her into the ICC top-20 rankings, marking a career-defining moment in India's commanding series against Ireland, as rising stars contributed to the team's historic highest-ever total in women's ODIs.

Chelsea's Christopher Nkunku eager to complete Bayern Munich move: ReportsChristopher Nkunku's potential return to Bayern Munich through a high-profile swap deal with Chelsea for Mathys Tel has sparked widespread interest, as both clubs explore a transformative move during the January transfer window.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
